entries.title: Practical Steps to Help Along Iran's Next Revolution | Opinion
entries.description: Iran has been shaken by repeated bouts of popular unrest ever since its Islamic Revolution overthrew Shah Reza Pahlavi in 1979. Unfortunately, none of its periodic outbursts of instability have led to permanent political change in Iran. Fortified by its cohesive clerical elite and the coercive muscle of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, the regime has been able to repeatedly suppress its disorganized opposition. Could this time be any different?

entries.title: Joe Biden Kneeling in Front of Golden State Warriors Raises Questions
entries.description: The team began laughing after Biden moved to take a knee as Vice President Kamala Harris gestured she would not be doing the same.

entries.title: George Santos Facing Fresh GoFundMe Allegations
entries.description: The New York Republican is accused of stealing money through the GoFundMe page of his fake pet charity, according to a disabled veteran from New Jersey.

entries.title: Housing Market Reckoning Won't Provide Salvation for Would-Be Homebuyers
entries.description: Though experts expect house prices to drop throughout the year, renters and first-time buyers are still struggling with affordability.

entries.title: Kyle Rittenhouse Furious After His Events Keep Getting Canceled
entries.description: The Kenosha gunman was due to appear in Conroe, Texas, and the Oak Room in Las Vegas' Venetian Resort before both events were nixed.

entries.title: Today's Wordle #578 Hints, Tips and Answer for Wednesday, January 18 Puzzle
entries.description: Newsweek has some hints and tips to help you crack today's "Wordle" puzzle.

entries.title: Tributes Paid to Jay Briscoe as Wrestling World Mourns Ring of Honor Pro
entries.description: The wrestling legend, who was only 38, was in a car accident in Laurel with his family on his way to attend a competition.

entries.title: The Problem With Gavin Newsom's Climate Change Agenda
entries.description: Has Newsom's climate change agenda been exposed to the elements? Extreme weather is placing California's power grid under strain, as it shifts to electric cars.

entries.title: Philadelphia Flyer Ivan Provorov Blasted for Pride Night Refusal
entries.description: "I respect everybody and I respect everybody's choices," Provorov said. "My choice is to stay true to myself ... That's all I'm going to say."

entries.title: Think Tank Points to New Sign Putin Is Preparing for Second Mobilization
entries.description: Vladimir Putin could announce a second draft this week as Russia's war in Ukraine continues, according to the Institute for the Study of War.

entries.title: Fox's Geraldo Rivera Slammed for Calling AR-15s 'Automatic Rifles'
entries.description: The veteran journalist and Fox News co-host incorrectly identified the military-style weapon during a segment of "The Five" on Tuesday.

entries.title: Newsweek's Fast Women Attempt Electric Vehicle Record
entries.description: Two podcast hosts are driving from Disneyland to Disney World, trying to set a new record.

entries.title: Ukraine Identifies Nearly 14,000 Children Abducted and Deported by Russia
entries.description: "Unfortunately, we can say that only 125 (of them) we managed to return home," the children's rights advocate said.

entries.title: Greta Thunberg's Detention Sparks Accusations of 'Fake Arrest'
entries.description: The activist was detained while protesting the expansion of a coal mine in Germany. Several conservative commentators have claimed the interaction was "staged."

entries.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Issues Stark Warning to Biden on Oversight
entries.description: Greene warned the president and the "Biden Crime Family" to "be prepared" after being assigned to the House Oversight Committee.

entries.title: New Detail in Bryan Kohberger Case Gives Defense Room to Fuel Doubt
entries.description: "It's gonna come down to a battle of the experts," former FBI agent Jennifer Coffindaffer told Newsweek about Kohberger's trial.

entries.title: Kari Lake Says Senate Rumors Are a Distraction From Election Lawsuit
entries.description: Lake denied reports from the "fake news" that she is considering a run for Arizona's Senate seat in 2024, which is currently held by Senator Kyrsten Sinema.

entries.title: George Santos Mocked Over Small Business, Science Committee Seats
entries.description: Astronaut Scott Kelly jokingly called Santos a "former NASA astronaut and moon walker" following his Science, Space and Technology Committee assignment.

entries.title: Mega Millions Drawing for 01/17/23, Tuesday Jackpot Is $20 Million
entries.description: Tuesday's jackpot is drastically different from the $1.348 billion prize won last Friday the 13th.
